title: Secret Santa
description: Michael gets upset when Jim promises Phyllis that she can be the office Santa, but the office Christmas party may be overshadowed by some bad news from David Wallace.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [yelling] Attention everyone! Jim and I, on behalf of-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Too loud.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: -the party planning committee...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Too, too loud. Too Loud.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But effective, look! [everyone turns to pay attention] On behalf of Jim and I, Merry Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: Merry Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Merry Christmas. Good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My diabolical plot is on hold for Christmas. My heart just melts with the sound of children singing. Hmmph! [laughs] Not really! I'm just tired. The days are short. I don't know. Maybe I'm depressed.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It is time to unveil the tree.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey, Rockefeller Center!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Uh, I have actually been to Rock Center, and this is nothing like that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: This is all we have.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Ugh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, it's not "ugh." It is... office camaraderie.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It is warm feelings.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Why don't we talk more about it instead of doing it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thirty! Twenty-nine! Twenty-eight! [others join]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why would you start so high?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Twenty- seven! Twenty-six! ...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Three, two, one! [pulls sheet to reveal Christmas tree]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Ooh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ah!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You didn't decorate it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Exactly.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We didn't, because we think it'd be better to do it together.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Everyone.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Why would you wrap it in a sheet, if you're not covering anything up?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Is it, is it fake?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, we are unveiling, an artificial tree, that will never die...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Like the spirit of Christmas!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: We're supposed to applaud you for taking a giant diaper off fake tree?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This was a successful unveiling! Go back to work! Merry Christmas!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hello. Sorry guys. [louder, face is scratched up.] Sorry guys. I'm not sure I've earned the right to make announcements yet. But whoever is giving me the Twelve Days of Christmas? As my Secret Santa? Please stop. I can't take it anymore. My cat killed a turtledove; the French hens have started pulling out my hair to make a nest. Please. Stop.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What psycho would send that as a gift? [Kelly hugs Erin]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I begged Dwight and Jim to give me Erin for Secret Santa. And I decided to give Erin the Twelve days of Christmas. Is it my fault that the first eight days is basically thirty birds? [six geese are inside Erin's car]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Ho ho ho! Merry Christmas boys and girls! It's me, Santa Claus!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey Santa!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: They finally let you do it!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Congrats Phil!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: It's so edgy!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I have been wanting to be Santa for years. I believe I have the right temperament, and the figure to do the job well. I slipped a note to Jim eleven weeks ago, and he said I could do it. [she awkwardly hugs Jim] It's been a long journey... but [sniffles] I'm Santa Claus!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So Santa, what can we expect from this party?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It's going to be a very jolly time if you've been good!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: What if you've been bad?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh then nothing but a lump of coal for you!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: What if you've been really, really bad? More evil, and strictly wrong?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Creed, we covered it. Lump of coal!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: For several weeks, my Secret Santa has been giving me pieces of a machine that I've been attempting to assemble. I'm suspicious of this because I had the exact same idea, for catching Osama bin Laden. I would simply send him a different piece each day. He would assemble it, to find himself... in jail!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You know Oscar every time I make this lasagna people ask me if it's a family recipe, but really, I just get the recipe from the box!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: That's funny.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Is it funny? I thought it was more ...interesting, than funny. [she walks over to see Oscar at the window looking down on man catching a football in parking lot]  I think my water just broke!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: That's too funny.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oscar and the warehouse guy! Go Oscar! Go gay warehouse guy!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Heeeeeere's Santa! Hey little girl, what would you like for Christmas? Ooh, you have been a very naughty girl, I see. [points to Pam's' pregnant tummy]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, we already have a Santa, Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What the hell is going on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Phyllis, Jim? Phyllis is Santa?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Phyllis?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah I told her a long time ago she could do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Take it back. That is absurd.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I'm not gonna do that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No? No! Jim! Come on!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think she's doing a good job.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's insane! A woman Santa, where does it stop? No! Jim, this may be the last Christmas that we have here, doesn't it make you a tiny bit anxious, me NOT playing Santa? Come on!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm not gonna go tell Phyllis that she can't be Santa.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Fine! Then do it anonymously. Ransom note style. You can- I -you know what, I have a bunch of letters cut out of magazines in my desk. You can use those.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If this were Russia, yeah sure. Everyone would go to one Santa, and there would be a line around the block and once you sat on her lap and she'd ask you what you wanted, you would say probably "freedom." At which point the KGB would arrest you and send you to Siberia. It's a good thing Russia doesn't exist anymore.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [santa voice] Ho ho ho! Why pay more to sit next to old Tranny Claus over there, when you can sit on my lap. Phyllis is only ... pretending to be a man, I'm the real thing. Sit down on my lap and there will be no doubt!

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: [mutters] Okay...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No it's not, not like penis-wise. [as Santa] Hello little boy, what's your name?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael it's me, Kevin. Phyllis says I'm too big for her lap.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh! I am so sorry that Phyllis hates you. And hates your body. But, Santa remembers a reindeer that was just a tiny bit different as well.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: When can I sit on your lap?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right now! Come on over here, big boy! There we go. [Kevin sits on his lap. It's a struggle] Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That's really comfortable. [Michael gasps]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What would you like for Christmas little boy?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I don't know. I didn't know you were gonna ask me that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What did you think was going to happen?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I didn't know. Nobody's ever let me sit on their lap before.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, just say "some toys" please.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Can you give me some choices? Cause I really don't want to mess up on this list.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Damn it Kevin, come on.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What about if I tell you the things I don't want?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay get off, get off! [pushes Kevin off] Oh! Oh, God!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I didn't even get to tell you what I wanted!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay you know what you get? You get a thousand helium balloons attached to you so Santa doesn't have to go through this again.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Awesome.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Well?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm trying Phyllis. You're Santa.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: The only Santa.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's what I want.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You promised me this. Don't make me get Bob involved!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What would Bob do?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Never mind, I shouldn't have said that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Does it hurt?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: It stings a lot.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I keep trying to figure out who's sending me these gifts.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I know, right?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: So far no one will admit to it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Huh!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Is it you? [Andy stage face, eyes pop, big mouth smile, Erin laughs]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah! Totally! I admit it! It's me.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Seriously?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: "Seriously?" Are you serious?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah! Totally serious! I'm your Secret Santa! Busted!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: There he is.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Is Matt around? I got his check.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Uh, Matt is on a delivery. Just leave it here, I'll take it.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Ah, I'll just... wait for him.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Matt's a pretty good-looking dude, don't you think?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'll just leave it here with you. [drops checks, leaves. Daryl smirks]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ryan come here!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Whoa, whoa.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on, come on.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'm doing something over here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ahhh... Ho ho ho! [struggles to pull Ryan towards him] Come on I need this. Come over here!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What are you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just sit down!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No no no.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey hey hey. Everything okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yup. Ryan and I are just having some fun!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Can I just talk to you for a second?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whoop! Okay, what?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You can't yell out "I need this, I need this" as you pin down an employee on your lap!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. You know what Jim, there are two Santas in the room. Things get ruthless!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you understand, you forced my hand?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael, it's Phyllis. We want Phyllis as Santa.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, do we? Do "We?" Is that what "we" want? Why don't "we" take a vote on it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Great!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey! Okay! Everybody! The office is being pulled apart! I realize that. There are traditions at stake. And there are-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Who wants Phyllis as Santa? [most everyone raises their hand]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No no no wait! No! There are other choices, there is information that we -[Dwight counts the raised hands] Are you kidding me? Kevin? After you almost killed me?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael I had you. I just want to try Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And if you want Michael as Santa, raise your hand. [Michael, then Dwight raises hand]  Can I get you some punch?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'll get some punch. That looks delicious. [shoves Santa hat into punch]

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: Aw, Michael!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Excuse me. Whoever has been sending me the parts to this gun, I think you sent me a gear instead of a trigger.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: How do you know it's a gun?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What else does it look like?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Not a gun.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well I don't have all the pieces yet.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Well, unless the missing piece is a gun, you don't have a gun.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not a gun. [crosses gun off his "what could it be" list]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: In the North Pole I spend many nights alone tinkering with toys. So today, let's put a twinkle in Ole Kris Kringle's eye! Let the party begin! [Dwight plugs in tree lights, office applauds.]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't ask for much for Christmas, I really don't. It's not like I'm begging people to buy me diamonds and ...broach pendants. "Oh buy me something expensive or I'm gonna kill myself."  That's not - I don't care about that. All I want to be is Santa. And, you want to take that away from me?  Fine. Go ahead. But when you need my help because I am ruining everything, don't look at me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Behold! [extends his arms] Jesus Christ. And I bring to you glad Christmas tidings. I want to remind everyone the true meaning of Christmas. [Angela claps] Those of you who wish to join me, that's great. I'm excited by that. And those of you who don't, I forgive you. But I never forget.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Wow Michael, like this must be obvious how wrong this is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh the Anti-Christ!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You can't, [Michael touches his forehead and makes sizzling noise] Ow. Look, you cannot push religion.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh but I can push drugs in here? Is that what you're saying?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well you have to pick one or the other. Your choice. Pick your poison. Get back to me. In the meantime, I am going to spread my goodness all over this company!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey Phyllis, could you not reveal to Erin that I'm her Secret Santa?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: All right sweetie, I'll tell her its Michael.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: {Kelly} and {Erin}
quotes.text: [singing] I saw three ships come sailing in, on Christmas day, on Christmas day...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Have you talked to him?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Who?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Matt?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Is it that obvious?  [Pam starts towards Matt] No- hey...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmm! Good pate, right? [Matt nods yes] Oscar made it. Have you met Oscar?

quotes.speaker: Matt
quotes.text: I don't think so.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Oscar, come here. Oscar, this is Matt, and um, Matt loves your pate.

quotes.speaker: Matt
quotes.text: I had some.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oscar's pate is great. I could eat it all day, every day. Mmm. How come the good ones are never straight, right?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Okay Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes! They're the only two gay guys I know. But they should be together.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: This just arrived from the Dunder Mifflin North Pole branch!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We don't have a North Pole branch. Idiot. [grabs package]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on karaoke microphone] Uh oh, what's Dwight gonna get? What is iiiit?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes! [Dwight opens package to reveal another machine part]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh yes. It's space garbage. Dwight's gonna be able to build himself a friend! [sings] Deck the halls with crappy gifts...

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Ho ho ho! For Stanley! Ho ho ho! You've been very good this year -

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I have.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on microphone] Yeah, except for cheating on your wife. Adultery's a sin, look it up in the Bible people. What'd you get?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: He got scented candles!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on microphone] Oh, that's appropriate. Lot of fire where you're going. Better get used to it. You're going to H-E-L-L double hockey sticks. You're going to Hell Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Amen.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: And this brings us to you, little one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on microphone] I can't see from here people. Somebody shout it out, don't make me get up.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It's fabric! I really wanted this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on microphone] That's fantastic. You can make another dress that goes past your feet.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Andy, is this you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on microphone] No!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: It's a secret.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on microphone] Andy had Erin.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Nnnnya.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on microphone] What? Was I not supposed to say it? [Jim unplugs mic] What? Turn it back on.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No. [Michael gets up and walks into his office]

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yes Michael, what is so urgent?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: David, guess who I'm sitting here dressed as.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I'm not going to guess. You can tell me or I am going to hang up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'll give you a hint. His last name is Christ. He has the power of flight. He can heal leopards.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Michael...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm Jesus, David, and you know why? Because Phyllis, a woman, has uslurped my role as Santa.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Michael-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: This is a very very bad time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? What's going on?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Stephanie, can you hop off please?

quotes.speaker: Stephanie
quotes.text: Sure David. [disconnect]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What the hell? How rude! Does she do that all the time?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Do you want me off the call too Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey! Get off! Get off the phone!

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Listen, I shouldn't tell you this, but the company has a buyer. The board will have no choice to approve. They are going to clean house.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What does that mean?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I'll be fired.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, can't Alan protect you?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Alan will be out too. All of us.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All of us?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Goodbye Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Earlier today this office needed a Santa. And then it needed a second Santa. And then it needed a Jesus. And now, it needs a Michael. And that's one suit Phyllis cannot fit into.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey. How's everybody doing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not great. You heckled Santa for an hour and a half.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That was a different guy. That was Jesus. Jesus sort of ruined the party. Hurt petulant Jesus.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Are you serious?  This is so offensive.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what's even more offensive, is baling on this party because some...  jerk ruined the first part of it. Dwight come here. Here's my debit card, I want you to go pick up a bunch of pizzas and meet me in the conference room.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What's your pin number?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't want to say. But, "it's fun to stay at the -" [nods to fill in blank, but Dwight doesn't know]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: "It's fun to stay at the -"

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Where? Holiday Inn? I don't ...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [gestures the YMCA dance] Mmm, mm mm mm. [Dwight smirks, leaves]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I, I thought that you would like it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: It was a little much Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well it's the thought that counts.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: What were you thinking? [Andy freezes]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I suppose a gentlemen might... throw in the towel, at this point. Guess what? Not gonna happen.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what, Christmas isn't about Santa, or Jesus. It's about the workplace. All of you feel like my family. Ryan, you are my son. And Pam, you're my wife. And Jim. And Angela and Phyllis, you are my Grandmas.  And Stanley, you're our mailman. And I can't help but look at all your wonderful beautiful faces and think, "How could they do this to us?"

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How could we do what? [general murmur]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's not... Nevermind. Nothing. [arguing voices]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: We deserve to know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I didn't say anything!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: If you know something Michael...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We're going out of business!

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: WHAT?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You are kidding me!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait wait wait, who said that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: David told me on the phone. David told me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: When? When did he tell you? Today?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Earlier today.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Awww!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He said, we have been sold. [upset murmurs]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Aaaarrhh!  [kicks over Christmas tree]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight! Jesus!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Come on!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael, wait. So they said we are sold?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: David's gone. Alan's gone. We're all gone.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay. We haven't gone under. We've been sold and that can mean many different things.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's hard for me to imagine a scenario, where Meredith Palmer keeps her job and David Wallace does not - no offense Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: No, I get it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'll call him. I'll call David.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, you won't, because he's not picking up his phone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, I will. Because I always know how to get through to him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He told me where his kids go to school. I call the school, I tell them I'm a pediatrician. They patch me through to his secretary. I use my little girl voice. Badda bing, badda boom.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Hey Sweetie, what is it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's not sweetie, it's Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: What the hell?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stephanie could you hop off please?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Michael, I have never-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: David!

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Ever, ever...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: David, you are on speakerphone with the entire branch, and the warehouse.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey David.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Hi David! [group hellos]

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Hello everyone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: David, they do not believe me. When you told me everyone was canned.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: You weren't supposed to tell anyone Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well I think we're past that now.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: I am not supposed to... Okay. Guys. I was really only talking about Alan, myself, a few other execs you don't know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh my God, David. That's horrible.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: How 'bout us? It's Meredith. By the way, your wife is a very lucky woman.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Look. They're buying the company for the distribution. You guys are the only thing about this company that works.  So congratulations.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We're not fired?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: No! No, and congratulations.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah! [office erupts in cheers and applause and hugs] It's a Christmas miracle!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Woo hoo! [climbs on desk, stage dives into crowd of employees]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [singing] I walk a lonely road, the only one that I have ever known. Don't know where it goes, but it's home to me and I walk alone. [Meredith and Madge help right the Christmas tree]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's true. We all walk alone.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [opens "New Moon" poster] Jim.... Jim! [Hugs him]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [singing] My shadow's the only one that walks beside me. My shallow heart's the only thing that's beating...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [opening kite from Ryan] Wow! Cause... [reveals Kite Runner book]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah! That was the idea.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Thank you!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Awesome!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Thanks man! [awkwardly tries to hug Ryan, pats him on the back]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [singing] Christmas tree, oh Christmas tree, thy leaves are so unchanging...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh! You got it? What is that? [Dwight building his gift]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have no idea.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Huh. Well, maybe those will help. [puts bag of walnuts on his desk]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael? Please! Come on!

quotes.speaker: Matt
quotes.text: Nice to meet you Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Nice to meet you Mark!

quotes.speaker: Matt
quotes.text: It's Matt.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Right, Matt. [Matt leaves] I know what I'm doing, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh man! [Dwight dropped a walnut into the nutcracker] I can use this for so many nuts! Macadamias, Brazil nuts, pecans, almonds. Clams, snails...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi Santa.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Hi Michael. [Michael sits on her lap] Mm. 'kay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'd like to make a wish.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I would like an Xbox, and a TV that's compatible with an Xbox. And, I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: An Xbox it is. Because I've decided you're a good boy.

quotes.speaker: Bob Vance
quotes.text: Scott! What in the hell is going on here? [Bob enters dressed as Santa too]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: No Bob, we worked it out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You called Bob?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I'm sorry,

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on! Phyllis!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I'm really sorry. It was earlier today.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Hi sweetie.

quotes.speaker: Bob
quotes.text: You okay baby?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I'm good baby. [they kiss, both dressed as Santa]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh God. Get a room Santas!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you Santa. Happy Holidays.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's real slippery out here. [sound of drummer's starts]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh my God!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Twelve drummers drumming. [marching drum band lines up to perform, Andy steps out with cymbals]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Merry Christmas Erin! Take it away boys! [dances along to the drumming]
